item.title: I need to put an ancient altar or whatever it's called in my home
item.description:
@5111 wrote:

open up your client.java and go to edit and then find type in makeGlobalObject you should find a list like this one

makeGlobalObject(2806, 2795, 2783, -2, 10);// Anvil makeGlobalObject(2843, 2964, 61, -3, 10); // Ancient Alter makeGlobalObject(3042, 4843, 2781, 0, 10);// Furnace makeGlobalObject(2791, 2789, 2193, 0, 10);// Chest makeGlobalObject(2788, 2788, 3816, 0, 10);// Kitchen Drawers makeGlobalObject(2805, 2795, 9398, 0, 10); // shopportal makeGlobalObject(3093, 3505, 7324, 0, 10); // blue portal makeGlobalObject(2797, 2784, 4172, -3, 10); // Range makeGlobalObject(2854, 3957, 61, 2, 10); // Ancient Alter makeGlobalObject(2852, 2953, 4389, 0, 10); // shopportal makeGlobalObject(3092, 3505, 2466, -2, 10);// red portal makeGlobalObject(2868, 9883, 2213, 0, 10); // bank makeGlobalObject(2868, 9882, 2213, 0, 10); // bank makeGlobalObject(2868, 9881, 2213, 0, 10); // bank makeGlobalObject(2859, 9881, 2213, 0, 10); // bank makeGlobalObject(2859, 9882, 2213, 0, 10); // bank makeGlobalObject(2864, 9881, 2932, 0, 10); //thing makeGlobalObject(2863, 9881, 2932, 0, 10); //thing makeGlobalObject(2511, 3864, 4172, 0, 10); // Range

yours may be longer but it goes

makeglobalobject(xcoord, ycoord, objid, 0 10

alter id is 6552

Read full topic
